column3: It was about twenty minutes to twelve. It was then I heard the lift. It's opposite Sister's suite - well, I expect you've seen it. I just heard the gentle clang of the doors and then a sort of purring sound as it went down.
Grant noticed the time. "It's 20 minutes until midnight. Who wants to help me hand out glasses and pour champagne?"

I went to the kitchen to select another bottle, deciding to reduce the next dayâ€™s alcohol intake to compensate. Then I saw the clock: 11:40 pm. I picked up the phone and ordered a taxi. With any luck it would arrive before the after-midnight tariff commenced.
Twenty minutes before midnight, before Oliver put an end to the festivities, she gave in to her impulse and texted her son, reminding him of their mutually agreed-upon curfew.

We all have the maps and appliances of various kinds that can be had. Professor Van Helsing and I are to leave by the 11:40 train tonight for Veresti, where we are to get a carriage to drive to the Borgo Pass. We are bringing a good deal of ready money, as we are to buy a carriage and horses.
